definition: to get it straight/to start to understand things properly/enlightenment dawns

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
unable to understand/can't get the point

sentences.english: As for me, I began to have an inkling.
sentences.chinese: 至于我，我开始有点开窍了。

sentences.english: He's surely a hard nut, nobody likes approaching him.
sentences.chinese: 他真是个脑子不开窍的人，没人愿意靠近他。

sentences.english: How can i enlighten your wooden head .
sentences.chinese: 我怎么才能让你这木头脑袋开窍呢？

sentences.english: Eye, as window of liver , are bright and clear-eyed .
sentences.chinese: 肝开窍于眼功能正常，眼睛明亮，视力清楚。

sentences.english: An agent, such as an analgesic drug, that relieves pain.
sentences.chinese: 敷这种膏药，不仅芳香开窍，而且理气止痛。

sentences.english: If we could get the committee to see the light, we would be able to pass the bill.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们能让委员会脑袋开窍，我们就可以通过法案。

sentences.english: Those hands-on classes can get a lot of these kids turned on.
sentences.chinese: 这些实践课，能使好多孩子开窍呢。

sentences.english: But maybe it will spark the boy off, it might give him the incentive to shoot more.
sentences.chinese: 但也许这能让这孩子开窍，这能激励他多多射门。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the effect of Yishen Kaiqiao instant granule on nervous deafness and tinnitus.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察益肾开窍冲剂治疗神经性耳聋耳鸣的疗效。

sentences.english: What does Anders discover about the song that "switched him on"?
sentences.chinese: 安德斯对于“让他开窍”的那首歌有什么发现？

definition: unable to understand/can't get the point
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
to figure out/to realize/to become convinced/to come round (to an idea)/to get over it
lit. to anoint your head with the purest cream (idiom); fig. to enlighten people with perfect wisdom/flawless Buddhist teaching
to give instructions/to give advice
a hint is all that is needed/understanding each other without the need to explain
to make progress/progress
to set sth upright or straight/to promote an employee from part-time to full-time (or from deputy to principal)/(old) to raise from concubine to wife status
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
intention/motive/state of mind/ambition/aspiration/heart 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
not normal/an aberration
to leak (gas)/to be discouraged/to despair/(disparaging) pathetic/to vent one's anger/(of a tire) to be flat
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
flexible/adaptable
